prs.title: [CRE-462] (feat): Add balance store to metering
prs.truncated_body:
### Description
Add a concurrency safe store for reserved balance. On calling the billing service, the engine will receive back the conversion rates. These rates are to be plugged into the balance store, along with the amount of universal credits that the Engine reserved based on its Workflow execution limits.

Also, moves metering to its own package within in the engine to promote code isolati

prs.title: DPA-1666: Support Virtual Stream IDs
prs.truncated_body:
[DPA-1666](https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/DPA-1666)

In order to support virtual stream IDs, we do a couple of things:
- include them in the job spec
- label the produced job with them, so we can handle the job by its stream id

Additionally, we moved all job-handling changesets under a dedicated submodule in order to reduce the mess.

[DPA-1666]: https://smartcontract-it.atla

commits.message: Support virtual stream IDs in median and quote streams.
Move job-handling changesets to a submodule.

prs.title: Fix remote trigger event expiry logic
prs.truncated_body:
Each workflow node waits for at least F+1 identical copies of each trigger event before trusting it and starting workflow execution.

Event copies need to be clustered within a relatively short time window (default = 1 minute). Anything received after that is rejected. The problem is that we can't trust the first received event to establish the "creationTs" - if one of them is sent too early, al

commits.message: Fix remote trigger event expiry logic

prs.title: Delete dydx-rewards EA
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The external adapter `dydx-rewards` is not referenced in RDD or infra-k8s, not by other external adapters.
@thomjg confirmed that it can be deleted.

It's also a maintenance burden because it has tests that fail when run on Mac but pass on GHA because they have floating point arithmetic that depends on CPU architecture. In particular, on [this line](https://github.com/smartcon

prs.title: Improve how pruning estimates how much of a table will be removed
prs.truncated_body:
Pruning can use one of two strategies to get rid of unneeded rows in a table: deleting or rebuilding. Rebuilding is better when we remove more than 50% of a table, otherwise, deletion should be used.

Currently, we estimate how much of a table will be removed by looking at the percentage of historical blocks we prune weighted by the ratio of entity versions to entities. This basically assumes th

commits.message: node, store: Make catalog::stats a method on Catalog
graph, store: Load estimates for the block range distribution in tables

graph: Improve estimate of how much of a table pruning will remove

Our current estimate is way too naive and causes a lot of unnecessary table
rebuilds. Using statistics from pg_stats should improve that

graph, store: Remove VersionStats.block_range_lower

We are not using those right now and there's therefore no point in storing
them

making changes, otherwise concurrent operations can cause deadlocks and

With this precompilation stage removed, the first test runs about a minute slower but the complexity of instantiating op-devstack incorrectly is significantly eased.

prs.title: [backport] feat: create update-bls-password cmd (#871)
prs.truncated_body:
This PR includes the following changes:

## Update the password encryption of the BLS key

- The existing password must be provided either via an interactive prompt or through the environment variable. For the security issue, existing password cannot be obtained by file.
- If previous version of BLS key does not have a password, enter empty value into prompt.
- The new password is managed us

commits.message:
feat: create update-bls-password cmd (#871)

This PR includes the following changes:

## Update the password encryption of the BLS key

- The existing password must be provided either via an interactive
prompt or through the environment variable. For the security issue,
existing password cannot be obtained by file.
- If previous version of BLS key does not have a password, enter empty
value into prompt.
- The new password is managed using the same set of flags that are used
when initially generating a BLS key.
- Users are asked to process updating password of BLS since
`bls_key.json` is overwritten with new password.
- The `BABYLON_BLS_PASSWORD` environment variable is used to load the
existing password. After running `update-bls-password`, users should
update this variable to reflect the new password.
- Since both `bls_key.json` and its associated password file are set to
read-only in [#850](https://github.com/babylonlabs-io/babylon/pull/850),
they are first removed and then recreated during the update process.
- A backup of `bls_key.json` is made during update-bls-password to
protect against potential errors. After `update-bls-password` completes
successfully, the backup of `bls_key.json` is removed.

```
$ babylond update-bls-password [flags]
```

Flags:
- `--no-bls-password`: Set the new password to an empty value (remove
the password).
- `--bls-password-file`: Path to the file where the new password will be
stored.

prs.title: FastForward blocks on StatelessSync mode
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

StatelessSync mode lets clients “fast-forward” without replaying the entire state history—by leveraging witness proofs, any client can sync in minutes by locating the closest Heimdall milestone before the latest checkpoint (see [heimdall-v2#221](https://github.com/0xPolygon/heimdall-v2/pull/221)) to retrieve its block’s Total Difficulty, and using a new `FastForwardThreshold` conf

prs.title: Move xdrgen Rust generator into this repository
prs.truncated_body:
### What
  Move the Rust xdrgen generator, currently embedded in xdrgen, into this repository. Use xdrgen the library with the generator located here as a custom generator to generate the Rust code for the XDR.

  ### Why
  The Rust generator is tightly coupled with the code in this repository. It would be pretty painful to use the generator in isolation of this code. The workflow we use when

commits.message: move xdrgen rust generator into repo

prs.title: chore: don't sort items in packaging
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Sorting items by amount of votes gives ability for malicious signer to delay or speedup some requests, thus it should be deleted

Closes: #1661

## Changes

- don't sort items in packaging anymore (however, we probably want to add sort by some other key in the future)

## Testing Information

No new tests needed

## Checklist:

- [x] I have performed a self-review o

commits.message: chore: don't sort items in packaging
make withdrawal id generated for withdrawals only

prs.title: chore: bump rust to 1.87 and address new clippy lint warnings
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

New rust, new clippy warnings.

https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/05/15/Rust-1.87.0/

## Changes

- Bumps the rust version to 1.87
- Addresses clippy warnings. Clippy has become much more anal regarding enum variant sizing (both in total size and size differences), so resolving a number of the warnings required boxing up a few things.
- Updated the `README.md` with the new

commits.message: bump rust to 1.87 and address new clippy issues

prs.title: adds config.json for C-Chain during antithesis - json logs
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Stop mixing json and text log formats during antithesis test in docker-compose.
Closes #3933 

## How this works

Per [documentation](https://build.avax.network/docs/nodes/chain-configs/c-chain) adding `config.json` file in the `$HOME/.avalanchego/configs/chains/C` with content:

```
{
  "log-json-format": true
}
```

Converts C-Chain logs to json forma

prs.title: fix: Correct HapiCryptoCreate staked account ID parsing
prs.truncated_body: When parsing the staked account ID for any `HapiCryptoCreate` operation, a recent assumption was made that only numeric or fully-qualified account IDs were passed. This assumption is incorrect–accounts stored in the spec registry are also called and need to be supported. This PR fixes the errant assumption.

commits.message:
Fix HapiCryptoCreate staked account ID parsing

Signed-off-by: Matt Hess <matt.hess@swirldslabs.com>

prs.title: feat: Support accepting/declining rewards in yahcli DAB transactions
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This version of yahcli adds support for defining node rewards behavior in the dynamic address book. For yahcli node create commands, the new `--declineRewards` flag indicates such to the consensus node, while a value of `--declineRewards false` indicates the intent to accept rewards. The node update command, keeping with the format of the staking command, now has two additional

commits.message:
Support accepting/declining rewards in yahcli DAB transactions

prs.title: MESH-2276 Add offchain and settlement integration tests. part 1
prs.truncated_body:
## changelog

### new features

- Support `<Bytes>...</Bytes>` wrapping when verifying off-chain signatures.
- Off-chain signatures for `Identity.add_secondary_keys_with_authorization`, `Identity.create_child_identities`, `Utility.relay_tx` and Settlement receipts are verified as both wrapped and unwrapped.  Unwrapped signing is no deprecated and support will be dropped in Polymesh v8.0.

commits.message: Add offchain and settlement integration tests.
Update polymesh schema file for SDK.
Refactor offchain wrapped signing in tests.
Add support for both wrapped and unwrapped message verification.

prs.title: Staking split
prs.truncated_body:
## changelog

### new features

- Moved Polymesh staking changes to `Validators` pallet.
- Use the `Staking` pallet from our fork of `polkadot-sdk` repo.

### modified external API

- Move extrinsics from `Staking` to `Validators` pallet: `add_permissioned_validator`, `remove_permissioned_validator, `validate_cdd_expiry_nominators`, `payout_stakers_by_system`, `change_slashing_allowed_for

commits.message: Revert benchmarking and testing utils to Substrate code.
Port our staking benchmarks onto the Substrate code.
Split the permissioned validator logic into a different pallet.
Move Polymesh types out of staking pallet.
